snippet: After a tragic safety record, railroad officials will evaluate the role an increase in passengers and trains played in 2013.
abstract: Joseph J Giulietti, president of Metro-North, gives news conference at Grand Central Terminal to address report released by Federal Railroad Administration that describe a railroad fraying even as it increased number of trains in operation to meet ridership demands; Giulietti says that railroad officials will evaluate whether unprecedented demand for services in 2013 played any role in railroad's declining safety record.
lead_paragraph: After a tragic safety record, railroad officials will evaluate the role an increase in passengers and trains played in 2013.

headline.main: Metro-North to Study Whether Surge in Riders Affected Railroad’s Safety
headline.print_headline: Metro-North to Study Whether Surge in Riders Affected Railroad’s Safety
